info.name: Speedy API examples v 1.3.0
info.description:
#### Guideline

This postman collection is created, based on the [examples](https://services.speedy.bg/api/api_examples.html) for [Speedy REST API](https://api.speedy.bg/web-api.html)

Please, set in the variables section of the collection, your `API_USERNAME` and `API_PASSWORD`, which must be provided by **Speedy team**, or by your contact person in **Speedy**. `API_BASEURL` is set as the starting URL for the Speedy API. For detailed information please visit the [information](https://api.speedy.bg/web-api.html#href-intro) about the API.

item.name: Create Shipment Request
1 - A shipment to an address
2 - A shipment to an ofice
3 - A shipment from an office and Third Party Payer
Print Request example
Print a waybill with one parcel
Print a waybill with multiple parcels
Get Contract Clients Request
Get Contract Clients
Find Country Request
1 - Search by full country name
2 - Search by part of the country name
3 - Search by country isoAlpha2
Find State Request examples
Search by full state name
Search by part of state name 2a
Search by part of state name 2b
Find Office Request
1 - Find offices in a country

request.description: Here `"countryId" : 100` is the id of Bulgaria

item.name: 2 - Find offices in a site

request.description: In the example: `"siteId" : 68134` is the id of the city Sofia

item.name: 3 - Find office by country and part of the name
4 - Find office in a site by part of the name
Find Site Request
1 - Search by part of the site name
2 - Search by exact site name

request.description:
`"countryId": 100` is for country Bulgaria  
Reminder:  
The site names in BULGARIA are not unique

item.name: 3 - Search site by name and post code

request.description:
`"countryId": 100` is for country Bulgaria  
Reminder:  
The combination from the name and post code is unique.

item.name: 4 - Search by site post code

request.description:
`"countryId": 100` is for country Bulgaria  
Reminder:  
The post codes in Bulgaria are not unique.

item.name: 5 - Search by site name, type and region

request.description:
`"countryId": 100` is for country Bulgaria  
Reminder:  
The combination from these three elements - `"language", "countryId"` and `"postCode"` is unique.

item.name: Find Complex Request
Search by part of the complex name
Find Street Request examples
1 - Search street details by part of the name
2 - Search street details by full street name
3 - Search street details by full name and type.
Find POI Request examples
Search poi details by part of the name
Destination Services Request
1 - The sender has clientId, the recipient is a private person
2 - The sender has clientId, the recipient is a private person in another country
Calculation Request
1 - A calculation to an address
2 - A calculation to an office
Track Request
1 - Track a parcel
2 - Track a parcel and return only last operation.
3 - Track more than one parcels with one request
Defined address examples
1 - Defined address via ids
2a - An address, defined by exact match from 'siteType' and 'siteName' exact match from 'streetType' and 'streetName'
2b - An address defined by exact match from 'siteType' and 'postCode', and exact match from 'streetType' and 'streetName'
3 - An address defined by ids of the site and the complex, and an exact match between 'streetType' and 'streetName'
4 - An address defined by exact match from 'complexType' and 'complexName' or/and exact match from 'streetType' and 'streetName'
5 - An address defined by 'siteId' and exact match from 'streetType' and 'streetName'
6 - The address defined by 'poiId' and some additional info filled in the 'addressNote'
7a - The whole address is placed in the 'addressNote' field

request.description: That kind of shipment will be not processed automatically and there are probabilities for mistakes and delay of the delivery.

item.name: 7b - The whole address is placed in the 'addressNote' field.

request.description: That kind of shipment will be not processed automatically and there are probabilities for mistakes and delay of the delivery.

item.name: 7c - The whole address is placed in the 'addressNote' field

request.description: That kind of shipment will be not processed automatically and there are probabilities for mistakes and delay of the delivery.

item.name: 8a - GERMANY Example - A foreign address (the addressType property has a value 2)

request.description: Here `"countryId": 276` is the country code of Germany. Also we are using `"serviceId": 306` because it is one of the services which are allowed from Bulgaria to Germany. Also, for service 306, `"parcels":` data for describing package size is a required data.

item.name: 8b - GREECE Example - A foreign address (the addressType property has a value 2)

request.description: Here `"countryId": 300` is the country code of Greece. Also we are using `"serviceId": 202` because it is one of the services which are allowed from Bulgaria to Greece.

item.name: 8c - FRANCE Example - A foreign address (the addressType property has a value 2)

item.description:
##### Explanation
The examples for address are presented for giving basic visualization on how the address can be structured based on the different scenarios.  
We are using the request for generating a shipment [CreateShipmentRequest](https://api.speedy.bg/web-api.html#href-create-shipment-req), to represent the examples in the recipient's address data.
